intro: Maesa angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan maesa, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pink and are followed by small, fleshy berries. Maesa angolensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
